intro: Eriospora virgata, commonly known as the white root grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grass family members. Eriospora virgata is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its root system is fibrous and can form dense colonies, contributing to soil stabilization in its native environment.
